title: Ban Appeal
body: It's been a year since I've been banned and I feel like I've changed over the past year. I've heard from friends I've got a short fuse and I tried working on it for the past year. I think I've really changed over the past year. What I said in chat was very toxic and not the impression I want to make. I want to turn over a new leaf whilst keeping all my progress. I've spent time and made new friends so I want to reconnect to this game because it seems like it's changed a lot. Thank you for reading and I hope you can approve my request.

replies.body: If it has been over a year, then you can try to write a very nice letter to support. An appeal, as you said. Maybe you'll say something that will allow them to reverse your ban. It HAS happenned before, but don't get your hopes up.

Start a new account if you've truly reformed.

Permanent is just that - forever.
Nobody gets unbanned, but nearly everyone is allowed to start over.

First, a name change seems to be in order Mr....uhhh....butteater3000. Secondly, you can contact support, but they won't unban you, thats only something they do for the people they sponsor or favorite, and it aint us

None has gotten unbanned except for cases that the ban was wrongfully issued in the first place.
Such as: 
1)Legit strategies that were wrongfully perceived as inting.
2)a 5-man group were someone troll-reported their friend and all 4 other people came forward and said it was a joke.

If you are thinking of T1. His accounts were never unbanned. He was just allowed to create new accounts from scratch and not have them banned as soon as Riot found out they belonged to him.
